page.title: 02A DAY AT NEWLAITHES SCHOOL
page.content: Wake up, get up and clean my teeth - downstairs for breakfast. Fill my bag with homework and things and walk to school. In the playground play football and wait for bell. Usually Maths first or finishing projects - assembly at 10.15. The headmaster reads a story and we sing a hymn - different children play instruments they are learning as we go out. Next playtime - mostly football. After its tests on tables or maths and sometimes current affairs. At lunchtime we line up with our trays - we choose from a menu and then it's playtime again. Afternoon school might start with Music Workshop, a BBC radio programme. One afternoon we do science and we do work on the computer. After play we may listen to talks about hobbies or we may do some art. 3.45 - it's home time. Often we have clubs to stay for.
